RelatedSentence: WOLFEBORO , N.H. - The 82 - year - old police official who publicly referred to President Obama by a racial epithet and then would not apologize has resigned his post , town officials here confirmed Monday .

WOLFEBORO , N.H. - The 82 - year - old police official who publicly referred to President Obama by a racial epithet and then would not apologize has resigned his post , town officials here confirmed Monday .
Robert Copeland , the head of Wolfeboro 's three - member police commission , turned in his resignation to the town manager and police chief Monday morning .

His resignation comes as several of New Hampshire 's most prominent politicians - including Sens. Kelly Ayotte ( R ) and Jeanne Shaheen ( D ) and Gov. Maggie Hassan ( D ) - had called for his ouster .
Several local lawmakers and community leaders also have called for Copeland 's resignation .
The firestorm erupted this month when Jane O'Toole , who moved to Wolfeboro about four months ago , overheard Copeland loudly describing Obama using the slur while sitting in a town restaurant .

The three - member police commission , an elected body charged with hiring the town 's police force , plans to meet this week .

Republican Mitt Romney , who challenged Obama in the 2012 election and who owns a vacation home in Wolfeboro , also has called for Copeland to resign .
